source: Refactoring: Improving the Design of Existing Code
author: Martin Fowler
quote: When you feel the need to write a comment, first try to refactor the code so that any comment becomes superfluous.

author: C. A. R. Hoare
quote: Premature optimization is the root of all evil in programming.

source: Refactoring: Improving the Design of Existing Code
author: Martin Fowler
quote: Whenever I have to think to understand what the code is doing, I ask myself if I can refactor the code to make that understanding more immediately apparent.

source: Refactoring: Improving the Design of Existing Code
author: Martin Fowler
quote: If you can get today’s work done today, but you do it in such a way that you can’t possibly get tomorrow’s work done tomorrow, then you lose.

author: Matsuo Bashō
quote:
Furuike ya
kawazu tobikomu
mizu no oto 

The old pond-
a frog jumps in,
sound of water.

author: Richard Brautigan
quote:
A piece of green pepper

  fell

off the wooden salad bowl:

  so what?

author: Kobayashi Issa
quote: This world of dew\nis a world of dew,\nand yet, and yet.

author: Katsushika Hokusai
quote: I write, erase, rewrite\nErase again, and then\nA poppy blooms.

author: Steve Sanfield
quote: The earth shakes\njust enough\nto remind us.

source: In a Station by the Metro
author: Ezra Pound
quote: The apparition of these faces\nin the crowd;\nPetals on a wet, black bough.

author: Kato Shuson
quote: I kill an ant\nand realize my three children\nhave been watching.

author: Matsuo Bashō
quote: No one travels\nAlong this way but I,\nThis autumn evening.

author: William Carlos Williams
quote:
so much depends
upon

a red wheel
barrow

glazed with rain
water

beside the white
chickens

author: Maya Angelou
quote:
Curtains forcing their will
against the wind,
children sleep,
exchanging dreams with
seraphim. The city
drags itself awake on
subway straps; and
I, an alarm, awake as a
rumor of war,
lie stretching into dawn,
unasked and unheeded.

author: Margaret Atwood
quote:
I’m telling the wrong lies,
they are not even useful.

The right lies would at least
be keys, they would open the door.

The door is closed; the chairs,
the tables, the steel bowl, myself

shaping bread in the kitchen, wait
outside it.

author: William Blake
quote:
O Rose thou art sick.
The invisible worm,
That flies in the night
In the howling storm:

Has found out thy bed
Of crimson joy:
And his dark secret love
Does thy life destroy.

author: Mahogany L. Browne
quote:
Each flower a wilting sun
The death of a new day is never kind
Grief ain’t no song
No loss is this romantic

source: I saw a man pursuing the horizon
author: Stephen Crane
quote:
I saw a man pursuing the horizon;
Round and round they sped.
I was disturbed at this;
I accosted the man.
“It is futile,” I said,
“You can never —”

“You lie,” he cried,
And ran on.

author: E.E. Cummings
quote:
Buffalo Bill ’s
defunct
who used to
ride a watersmooth-silver
stallion
and break onetwothreefourfive pigeonsjustlikethat
Jesus
he was a handsome man
and what i want to know is
how do you like your blue-eyed boy
Mister Death

author: Joy Harjo
quote: Invisible fish swim this ghost ocean now described by waves of sand, by water-worn rock. Soon the fish will learn to walk. Then humans will come ashore and paint dreams on the dying stone. Then later, much later, the ocean floor will be punctuated by Chevy trucks, carrying the dreamers’ decendants, who are going to the store.

author: Langston Hughes
quote:
What happens to a dream deferred?
Does it dry up
like a raisin in the sun?
Or fester like a sore—
And then run?
Does it stink like rotten meat?
Or crust and sugar over—
like a syrupy sweet?
Maybe it just sag
like a heavy load.

Or does it explode?

author: W. E. B. Du Bois
quote: It is a peculiar sensation, this double-consciousness, this sense of always looking at one's self through the eyes of others, of measuring one's soul by the tape of a world that looks on in amused contempt and pity.

source: A Coney Island of the Mind #9
author: Lawrence Ferlinghetti
quote:
See
    it was like this when
        we waltz into this place
a couple of far out cats
       is doing an Aztec two-step
And I says
     Dad let's cut
but then this dame
         comes up behind me see
               and says
       You and me could really exist
Wow I says
    Only the next day
      she has bad teeth
        and really hates
               poetry

author: Edna St. Vincent Millay
quote:
My candle burns at both ends;
It will not last the night
But ah, my foes, and oh, my friends—
It gives a lovely light!

author: Carl Sandberg
quote:
The fog comes
on little cat feet.

It sits looking
over harbor and city
on silent haunches
and then moves on.

author: Marilyn Singer
quote:
april is a dog’s dream
the soft grass is growing
the sweet breeze is blowing
the air all full of singing feels just right
so no excuses now
we’re going to the park
to chase and charge and chew
and I will make you see
what spring is all about

author: Brian Kernighan
quote: Don’t comment bad code – rewrite it

author: Dan Salomon
quote: Sometimes it pays to stay in bed on Monday rather than spending the rest of the week debugging Monday’s code.

author: William Laeder
quote: Debugging becomes significantly easier if you first admit that you are the problem.

author: Doug Linder
quote: A good programmer is someone who always looks both ways before crossing a one-way street.

author: Steve Maguire
quote: Fix the cause, not the symptom.

author: Oscar Wilde
quote: A bore is someone who deprives you of solitude without providing you with company.

author: Phil Knight
quote: Play by the rules, but be ferocious.

author: Jack Kerouac
quote: One day I will find the right words, and they will be simple.

author: Jack Kerouac
quote: One man practicing kindness in the wilderness is worth all the temples this world pulls.
